technology.title: Florida's sea cows are addicted to power plants

travel.title: China's sweet dumpling to remember the dead
travel.description: China's qingtuan is a sweet, jade-coloured treat eaten to commemorate the dead during spring's Qingming Festival, or Tomb Sweeping Day.

blocks.altText: Photo of quintuan (Credit: Imaginechina Limited/Alamy)

travel.title: The 'calorie-bomb' avocado smoothie for Ramadan
travel.description: Moroccan ZaaZaa is a thick and sweet avocado smoothie that resembles a layered sundae and satisfies as a post-fasting treat during Ramadan.

blocks.altText: Photo of ZaaZaa (Credit: Alia Al Kasimi)

travel.title: The Jamaican answer to the hot cross bun
travel.description: During Easter, soft cheese sandwiched between two slices of moist, fruit-infused spiced bun make up a savoury-sweet Jamaican tradition

blocks.altText: single bun and cheese

travel.title: The recipe for a centuries-old Easter baba made with 96 eggs
travel.description: The baba is often served at Easter in Poland, with the most extraordinary version – the muslin baba – made from a rich dough of flour, yeast, butter and quite a lot of egg yolks.

blocks.altText: Bundt cake with lemon glaze

travel.title: An ancient cannabis drink for celebrating Holi
travel.description: Through many centuries in India, the Festival of Colours has been celebrated with thandai, a cooling milk drink packed with dry nuts, fragrant spices and oftentimes, cannabis.

blocks.altText: Photo of thandai (Credit: Yuliya Furman/Getty Images)
